meanings.definition: Glucokinases: enzymes that facilitate the phosphorylation of glucose to glucose-6-phosphate in the liver and pancreas.
meanings.sent1: The glucokinases in the liver help convert glucose to glucose-6-phosphate.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the role of glucokinases in glucose metabolism.
meanings.sent3: The glucokinases in the pancreas are like little helpers turning glucose into glucose-6-phosphate.
meanings.sent4: In the body, glucokinases act as the key that unlocks the door to glucose-6-phosphate production.
meanings.sent5: Imagine glucokinases as tiny workers diligently transforming glucose into glucose-6-phosphate.
